Posts.Content: OH Geez...I have been having joint pain in my right wrist since I stared taking the Arimidex right after my surgery...I just thought the pain was coming from a possibility that they had to secure my right arm during the surgery & maybe the bone got bruised or something...some days I can't hardly use my right hand cause the joint hurts so bad & it gets red & swells too. Never once did I relate it to the meds. So good to know that it's not all in my mind...I mentioned it to the dr. but he just said, I needed to continue the arm exercises they gave me to do after the surgery to strengthen the arm & muscles...So now I've got something to go on & ask him when I go back. So sorry that others are having this problem also...but it's helpful to share these things, that's why I am thankful I found this forum...I don't post much, just read, but I never had to have any chemo or radiation, so it's for sure my wrist pain it's not related to that. I hate it for us all that we think we got one problem solved, & then the meds we have to take causes another problem. There should be a ( relief) zone in there somewhere.
Posts.Signature: MomG DX 11-23-05 @ 65 yrs. old. Simple mastectomy RB 0.7 cm 1-6-06ER- 3+PR- 3+HER2/nev (herceptest) Negitive, 0+Main Sentinel Node - NegetiveArimidex 1mg. for next 5 years. Onc. Stopped the Arimidex, too much pain & side effects. Evista 60mg. a day. No osteoporosis. No Chemo or radiation. Mother, lung, liver cancer, Aunt, BC, Sister, Bile Duct Liver cancer
Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: Hey Nancy, I talked to my onc. & he tried several different ones, but I still had severe side effects, same as with Arimidex...Joint pain, blurred vision, food wouldn't go down so threw it up, bowels wouldn't move, burning & itching when I had to void, so ended up in hospital to have test done on kidneys. My onc. decided that I couldn't tolorate the estegron blocker meds & he stated that my chances of getting cancer again without the meds was less than 15%...so I told him I would take my chances rather than stay on five meds for the side effects. I was like you, my fingers locked up & had places hurt that I didn't know I had...I had to wear a brace on my right wrist it hurt so bad....I will surely keep the Actonel in mind if I have to go back on anything....I am on 60MG Evista for bone strength...I don't have osteroposis either...just a preventive. I see you have diabetes also. I too am border line now as of Nov. 2006
Posts.Signature: MomG DX 11-23-05 @ 65 yrs. old. Simple mastectomy RB 0.7 cm 1-6-06ER- 3+PR- 3+HER2/nev (herceptest) Negitive, 0+Main Sentinel Node - NegetiveArimidex 1mg. for next 5 years. Onc. Stopped the Arimidex, too much pain & side effects. Evista 60mg. a day. No osteoporosis. No Chemo or radiation. Mother, lung, liver cancer, Aunt, BC, Sister, Bile Duct Liver cancer
Posts.Title: Breast prosthetics

Posts.Content: I had my right breast removed & one node...I have worn my prosthetics since 3 months after the surgery...mainly for balance purposes, not because I'm ashamed...I agree with Muttsmom, I'm just thankful to be alive & cancer free...I do water aerobic 3 times a week & I've talked to the instructor & she has told me there are certain things I can't do & if I feel the least bit of discomfort, to not do the exercise....Also I work out in the gymn, & she told me there are certain machines I ABSOLUTILY can't use...So you do need to tell your instructor...they deal with this all the time....that's their job to help us, not to treat us a some sickO!....I've found they all are very thoughtful...We have nothing to be ashamed of, we are "Survivors"...
Posts.Signature: MomG DX 11-23-05 @ 65 yrs. old. Simple mastectomy RB 0.7 cm 1-6-06ER- 3+PR- 3+HER2/nev (herceptest) Negitive, 0+Main Sentinel Node - NegetiveArimidex 1mg. for next 5 years. Onc. Posts.Title: Breast prosthetics

Posts.Content: Amazonian, That's what this is all about....expressing our inner deep feelings...we are all different & adjust differently...How long has it been since your surgery?....As for myself...I was quiet anxious to get my prosthetic because of the balance...it was so noticible...I will admit, it was an experience to adjust & sometime just down right flustrating to put in & take out... ...but now I have came to adjust & feel quiet comfortable with it in...I even sleep with it because I sleep on my right side & there was no comfortable position because of the missing breast...I have a everyday one & then the silicone one...What works for one, doesn't always work for others, but it's good to know others experiences...out of all the forums I've been too, this is the best one for expressions & information on others experiences. I pray for the best for you.

Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: Hey Sharon, Thanks for your reply....it is so helpful to know that others are experincing the same problem with the meds. Yes, I am right handed & I have the same problem trying to pull the covers up, but I'm not having the hot flashes, done been there, done that, but my Oncologist said that was one of the side effects, but never mentioned the muscle or joint pain...I use that wrist support also...it seemed to give me some relief, but when I take it off, Bingo, the pain is back & you can't wear that thing all the time & do any kind of house work. I just started taking the Arimidex in March after my surgery in January, so seems I had a fast reaction to it according to what I have read compaired to others. I am sure going to call my oncologist & ask him about this, because my next appointment isn't till August 1st. & I sure don't want to wait that long to get some relief. Yes, it is good to know we aren't crazy & alone in this...I had my surgery Up State Ithaca NY where my daughter lives & the oncologist there was more thorough in explaining things to me than the one I have here in Va. I might just give him a call since he's the one to put me on this. Thanks for the info. God Bless & hang in there.

Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: I went for my check up with dr & he did a urin test & found bacteria & also a trace of blood, & put me on a RX for the bacteria & gave me a cream to relieve the itiching. He also said I was carring about 10 lbs. of fluid. so got appointment with Uroglist to find out what is happening tomorrow. I am also having problems with food digesting & swelling right after I eat, so am taking zantac for that & lasix for the swelling. My dr. thinks all these side effects are coming from the Armidex because my body isn't getting enough estragon, so now I am going to discuss this with the onc. about coming off the Armidex & see if I can find a "normal" again...I am so tired of just as soon as I eat, it either comes back up or I start bloting up & feel like the new years blimp. I was only on one medicine till I started taking the Armidex, & now I am taking 5 different meds for all the side effects. I had rather take my chances of the cancer coming back than to have to take so many meds for side effects & then they cause more side effects & on & on....I started taking water exercises at the gym & it has helped me in getting some strength back in my right arm & eased some of the muscle pain. Just hope we all can get some relief soon & these doctors start listening to us. Hang in there everyone, together we can make it...

Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: Sandra, I'm sure by now you have already been fitted for your prostesis, but I have a protesis & it's silicone...it has a cover that can be taken off & washed...I also have what they call the everyday one which can be washed it's self. It some kind of foam stuff & not as heavy as the silicone one. Medicare paid for it all...I also have this tank top that came with two fiber filled stuff that can be washed also...I use those when I take the arobic classes....You can get the prostesis just for swiming, but Medicare won't pay for any swim ware. I'm sure you are going to be ok with the prostesis...I was, & now I don't even notice I've got it on...I've only had mine since March. ...At least now I feel more comfortable....

Posts.Title: prostesis fitting tomorrow - what's better??

Posts.Content: Hi PinkGirl! I was on Arimidex last year & had to take five meds for the side effects...I too had joint pain, also food wouldn't digest..threw it up, couldn't have a BM, had blurry vision, ended up in hospital for my kidneys. Dr tried me on another one but it did the same thing....Everyone's body is different, so I suggest you discuss it with your Onc. & see what he says about trying other meds. Some people can tolorate one thing, when others can't. My onc. thoght it best I come off all the meds, as I couldn't tolorate them and since I'm not at high risk , I am much better now...Keep us posted as how you are doing & what your onc. tells you.

Posts.Title: Arimidex side effect?

Posts.Content: Hey Rosemarie, Sorry to hear you are facing this kind of surgery. I had a complete right breast Mastectomy 1-6-2006. I am now 3 years 1 mo. 1 day cancer free. Being put to sleep didn't bother me & I don't remember much of anything that day cause I slept most of it...There will be adjustments to make & your body will learn to adjust to the strange parts, but you will be fine...I agree with Brainman, your mental attitude has a lot to do with what happens in your recovery..I know it can be scary facing the unknown, but if you are stressing out about this, then you need to talk to your dr before the surgery & let him know how you feel...My dr told me that my positive attitude helped my recovery go well...I didn't have the reconstruction, so I can't advise you there...don't stress about crossing the bridge till you get to it. My prayers & thought are with you.

Posts.Title: tamoxifen

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with right breast cancer & had a Mastectomy Jan.6,2006. The maine lymph node was canser free, so they only removed the one. I thought my healing was going good till I went back to dr. the week after & found that all the top skin had died & turned black. Each week she removes a layer of the dead skin & hopefully this week she can get it all off. This has been a set back & is getting on my nerves. Dr. says I will have a huge scar now that she didn't intend to be there...Has anyone else experienced this? & if so, how long did it take for you to completely heal up. MomG

Posts.Title: Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hey Matynne, No it didn't get infected, just not enough blood flow to the outer skin that the Dr. sewed back up & that caused the top layer to die..It's all healed up now since I am 4 months PO. but I came home in March & had the surgery in Jan. & it wasn't quiet healed up then. Dr thought she was going to have to do a skin graft, but thank God she didn't have too...The scar is much bigger than it was supposed to be but they think in time it will fade.

Posts.Content: Km..I didn't have any lumps or any symptoms...The cancer I had was in a mass of fiber looking stuff that showed up in the mamogram....so I suggest if you are concerned about something, see your doctor to schedual a mamogram.

Posts.Title: symptoms

Posts.Content: I agree with Jim on this, that the tumor doesn't need to be there to test the lymph nodes for cancer...I had a Mastectmy in January 2006, I only had a mass, no lumps to the feel, so the Dr. did a biopsy of the mass first to see if there was any cancer cells & there was, so when I had the surgery the surgon injected me with radioactive tracer & the blue dye, & it went to the main Sentinel node & they took it out & sent for a biopsy & it showed no cancer...if the first node shows no cancer, then there isn't any cancer in the other nodes, so they only have to take the one. I would question that dr for more details of what he plans to do, & always take someone with you to help you remember what was said, believe me, you won't remember all that you are told. Make notes also of what to ask. I wouldn't worry about this till I got the results back from the biopsy, cause you can't make a decision until you know what it is. Good luck & my prayers are with you. [/b]
Posts.Signature: MomG DX 11-23-05 @ 65 yrs. old. Simple mastectomy RB 0.7 cm 1-6-06ER- 3+PR- 3+HER2/nev (herceptest) Negitive, 0+Main Sentinel Node - NegetiveArimidex 1mg. for next 5 years. Onc. Stopped the Arimidex, too much pain & side effects. Evista 60mg. a day. No osteoporosis. No Chemo or radiation. Mother, lung, liver cancer, Aunt, BC, Sister, Bile Duct Liver cancer
Posts.Title: biopsy needed, but...

Posts.Content: Hey Flmd, I don't have the answers for you, but I was on the Arimidex for about 4 months after my Mastectomy & had to take 5 different meds for the side effects..One of the worst was my digestive system...I got to the point I dreaded to eat because my food either wouldn't go down or it came back up. I talked to my family Dr & also the oncoligist & they both agreed that my chances of getting cancer again without the Arimidex was less than 15%...so I came off the med. I am not suggesting you do that, because everyone is different. I didn't have to take chemo. I would talk in depth with the oncoligist about more explation of why the cyst show up now. Wish I could have been more helpful... My prayers are with you.

Sorry to hear you are facing even more surgery ahead...I know from experience it's hard, but just try to keep a positive attitude & show that as much as possible, this is what has brought me this far...my thoughts & prayers are with you. Posts.Content: That's a good subject Mike, I have often wondered this myself & since I haft to have two Mammograms a year now, I am wondering what effects it will have on my other organs & how long will it take to show up somewhere. On to a more positive note....I am ONE year cancer free as of January 6th.

Posts.Title: Mammogram Radiation

Posts.Content: I'm new here & posted once before, but I must have done something wrong...I am 66 yrs. old & just had a right breast Mastectomy Jan. 6, 2006 with the first sentinal node removed & no cancer found. I was diagnosed November 9 th. with possible stage ll but after the surgery, the biopsy showed it was not quiet a stage 1, which I am thankful, & am now cancer free. When I went back a week after the surgery the top layer of skin started dying & was all black. & the smell was over whelming My surgon was very dissapointed & shocked it did this, so each week she has been removing a layer of the dead skin & it's healing fine but is leaving a deep hole in the chest wall, which she says I will proballly need a skin graft to fill it in now after it all heals. In 2 days it will be a month since the surgery & I thought I'd be almost healed by now. Has anyone else experenced anything like this & am I expecting to much from my body to soon?

AgeInfo.Phrase: done something wrong   I am 66 yrs <Z> <Z> <Z> <Z>

Posts.Signature: MomG DX 11-23-05 @ 65 yrs. old. Simple mastectomy RB 0.7 cm 1-6-06ER- 3+PR- 3+HER2/nev (herceptest) Negitive, 0+Main Sentinel Node - NegetiveArimidex 1mg. for next 5 years. Onc. Stopped the Arimidex, too much pain & side effects. Evista 60mg. a day. No osteoporosis. No Chemo or radiation. Mother, lung, liver cancer, Aunt, BC, Sister, Bile Duct Liver cancer
Posts.Title: I'm new Here!

Posts.Content: Hey Jill, Thanks for the respond...I have been trying to find someone to talk to for several weeks now & you are the first one to reply.. No I didn't get any kind of infection..my dr. said it was from a lack of blood flow getting into the top layer of skin that caused it to die & this might happen one in a thousand, course I had to be that one....lol..No I don't need any other kind of treatment..just have to take calcuim & a multiple vitamin for now. This was the reason I chose a Mastectomy, so I wouldn't have to take all the radiation or cemo & then take a chance on it coming back later...10 years ago I was diagnosed with cancer but then I requested a second opinion of the biopsy & it was cancer free. So I think this time, even though it was in the first stage & very small, I made the right choice of getting rid of it all so in another 10 years or so I won't have to face this again.
Posts.Signature: MomG DX 11-23-05 @ 65 yrs. old. Simple mastectomy RB 0.7 cm 1-6-06ER- 3+PR- 3+HER2/nev (herceptest) Negitive, 0+Main Sentinel Node - NegetiveArimidex 1mg. for next 5 years. Onc. Stopped the Arimidex, too much pain & side effects. Evista 60mg. a day. No osteoporosis. No Chemo or radiation. Mother, lung, liver cancer, Aunt, BC, Sister, Bile Duct Liver cancer
Posts.Title: I'm new Here!

Age.Phrase: done something wrong   I am 66 yrs <Z> <Z> <Z> <Z>

DoctorRecommended.Sample: Being put to sleep didn't bother me & I don't remember much of anything that day cause I slept most of it...There will be adjustments to make & your body will learn to adjust to the strange parts, but you will be fine...I agree with Brainman, your mental attitude has a lot to do with what happens in your recovery..I know it can be scary facing the unknown, but if you are stressing out about this, then you need to talk to your dr before the surgery & let him know how you feel...My dr told me that my positive attitude helped my recovery go well...I didn't have the reconstruction, so I can't advise you there...don't stress about crossing the bridge till you get to it. My prayers & thought are with you....I am now 3 years 1 mo. 1 day cancer free. Being put to sleep didn't bother me & I don't remember much of anything that day cause I slept most of it...There will be adjustments to make & your body will learn to adjust to the strange parts, but you will be fine...I agree with Brainman, your mental attitude has a lot to do with what happens in your recovery..I know it can be scary facing the unknown, but if you are stressing out about this, then you need to talk to your dr before the surgery & let him know how you feel...My dr told me that my positive attitude helped my recovery go well...I didn't have the reconstruction, so I can't advise you there...don't stress about crossing the bridge till you get to it....
